content:
Hello everyone,
in Germany, we are currently working on a project in which I write my PhD. It contains a mapping from FHIR to OMOP (and probably vice versa) for wound related data. I just had a look at the Implementation guide May referenced in another stream (https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/cdmh/index.html), but it seems to be quite US-specific. Therefore my question: If it is intended to be US-specific, is there any intention to lift it to an international basis? I ask because the mappings contain several extensions we don't have in Germany, which limits its applicability for us.
Thanks in advance for your answers.
sorry, my fault. Not extensions, but profiles.
but for example in Germany "race" and "ethnicity" are forebidden, thus the extensions used in us-core are not allowed and are therefore not mapped.

@Mareike Przysucha I think CDMH was indeed intended to map to US Core specifically. But there are a bunch of OMOP-FHIR mappings out there and there are more planned still...

Is yours the same as the MIRACUM one or should it be added to the list?

Thank you, @Ward Weistra. It is a new project called ZIEL (goal in English), which is an acronym for "reduced time to healing via more evidence through augmented intelligence - in German ZIEL makes more sense...
Should I add it to the other stream?

"race" and "ethnicity" are forebidden

But that doesn't mean you can't use the mappings generally, just not those ones, since the data will never exist in your source FHIR content anyway?
True. We are just at the beginning right now and I look around for what might be relevant for us. The CDMH IG is definitely on that list. I was just wondering...

Mareike Przysucha said:

Should I add it to the other stream?

Yes please! With any public documentation/status you can share.

Hey everyone.
I have a question to the CDMH IG, which might also be interesting for the new collaboration.

On the page http://hl7.org/fhir/us/cdmh/2019May/profiles.html, it says that the field discharge_to_concept_id should be filled with the content of Encounter.location.location.type. But should it not better be hospitalization.dischargeDisposition?
If I understand correctly, locationis where the patient has been, and hospitalization.dischargeDisposition where the patient shall be discharged to. The description for discharge_to_concept_id seems to be more applicable to the latter.
Do I see that correctly, or am I mistaken? In the latter case, can someone explain to me what I get wrong?
Thank you in advance for your help.
